name: Brooklyn Museum
description: Located on Long Island in New York City's borough of Brooklyn, it is the second-largest art museum in New York City, and one of the largest in the United States.

name: Brooklyn Tabernacle
description: The Brooklyn Tabernacle is one of New York City's largest churches and Grammy Award winning Choir.

name: Brooklyn Bridge
description: Built in 1874, the Brooklyn Bridge is the oldest existing suspension bridge in the U.S.

name: Coney Island
description: Between about 1880 and World War II, Coney Island was the largest amusement area in the United States; today, it contains two amusement parks and several other attractions clustered around the Riegelmann Boardwalk.

name: Prospect Park
description: The country's longest open park meadow, with ancient trees in Brooklyn's only extant forest.

name: Citi Field
description: The home stadium of the New York Mets baseball team.

name: Rockaway Peninsula
description: Also called The Rockaways, a popular summer resort area since the 1830s, containing the Rockaway Beach and Boardwalk and Jacob Riis Park on its southern shore.

name: Unisphere
description: The symbol of Queens, the Unisphere is a giant globe in Flushing Meadows Park.

name: Jones Beach
description: Jones Beach Tower, now a familiar Jones Beach State Park landmark, was modeled on the campanile of St Mark's Basilica in Venice.

name: Nassau Veterans Memorial Coliseum
description: Former home arena of the New York Islanders hockey team.

name: Old Westbury Gardens
description: Charles II - Westbury House, style mansion designed by George A. Crawley, contains 23 rooms. The grounds cover 160 acres.

name: Planting Fields Arboretum State Historic Park
description: An arboretum and state park covering over 400 acres (160 ha) located in the Village of Upper Brookville in the town of Oyster Bay, New York.

name: Sagamore Hill
description: Sagamore Hill was the home of the 26th President of the United States, Theodore Roosevelt, from 1886 until his death in 1919.

name: Welwyn Preserve
description: Welwyn Preserve was the estate of Harold I. Pratt. It is now a 204 acre nature reserve, and the mansion houses a Holocaust museum

name: Bald Hill
description: Bald Hill Memorial is located in Farmingville, NY. This destination pays tribute to U.S. Veterans to honor the men and women that served the country during the Vietnam War.

name: Captree State Park
description: A state park located on the south shore off Jones Island (the barrier island that includes Jones Beach), overlooking the Fire Island Inlet Bridge and the westernmost section of Fire Island. Captree is a fisherman's haven and a picnicker's delight.

name: Fire Island Light
description: Fire Island Lighthouse is a 180 foot stone tower that began operation in 1858  replacing the 74 foot tower originally built in 1826.

name: Great South Bay Bridge
description: The Robert Moses Causeway, over The State Channel and Fire Island inlet bridges to one of Long Island's great Atlantic coast islands such as Fire and Jones Beach Island connecting New York's Ocean Parkway.

name: Long Island Game Farm
description: (Petting Zoo) with over 200 animals. The Long Island Game Farm is one of the island's oldest and most well-known establishments.

name: Port Jefferson Harbor
description: Port Jefferson Harbor continues to attract mariners, visitors, tourists, and families to an area where natural beauty is the setting for a wide variety of activities, including a ferry service to Connecticut.

name: Splish Splash
description: Splish Splash is a 96-acre water park in Riverhead, New York.
